intro: Adelmeria undulata, commonly known as the woolly curlcup, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Cactaceae family, characterized by its succulent stems and modified leaves. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its stems are covered in dense, woolly hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Adelmeria undulata is typically found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun.
